summary: Spider-Man: Far From Home Synopsis Confirms Peter Is Working For Fury
title: Spider-Man: Far From Home Synopsis Confirms Peter Is Working For Fury
excerpt: A synopsis for Spider-Man: Far From Home reveals that Tom Holland's Peter Parker is working for Samuel L. Jackson's Nick Fury.
description:
It was confirmed in September that Samuel L. Jackson’s Nick Fury will appear in Spider-Man: Far From Home, but the nature of his role wasn’t divulged. But a new synopsis for the upcoming sequel confirms that Tom Holland’s young wall-crawler will be working for the former S.H.I.E.L.D. director.

The description reaffirms Peter Parker’s summer vacation in Europe, while teasing he’ll have to make time for his costumed alter ego to investigate some unforeseen events:

Peter Parker and his friends go on summer holidays to Europe. However, the friends will hardly be able to rest-Peter will have to agree to help Nick Fury uncover the mystery of creatures that cause natural disasters and destruction throughout the continent.

The synopsis alludes to the minor mystical villains, The Elementals, referenced in the description of the trailer screened over the weekend at Comic Con Experience in Sao Paulo, Brazil.

RELATED: Spider-Man: far From Home Photo Gives New Look at Stealth Suit

This will also be the fourth time in an adaptation that Spider-Man and Fury have crossed paths, following Spider-Man: The Animated Series, in which Fury and S.H.I.E.L.D. were recurring characters; a cameo in Spider-Man Unlimited; the Ultimate Spider-Man video game; and perhaps most infamously, the Ultimate Spider-Man animated series, in which Fury made Spider-Man a S.H.I.E.L.D. agent as part of a training program.

Directed by Jon Watts, Spider-Man: Far From Home stars Tom Holland, Zendaya Coleman, Marisa Tomei, Michael Keaton, Jake Gyllenhaal, Samuel L. Jackson, Cobie Smulders, Jon Favreau, Jacob Batalon, Remy Hii, and Tony Revolori. It is scheduled to be released on July 5, 2019.

(via Screen Rant)

summary: Please go see Spider-Man: Into the Spider Verse. You have no idea how heart breaking it is to see that the movie theater I just...
body:
Please go see Spider-Man: Into the Spider Verse. You have no idea how heart breaking it is to see that the movie theater I just bought tickets to see it Saturday Night has only 1 pre-sold ticket (my ticket).

This movie is spectacular! It needs to be seen in theaters.

summary: “The Marvel Sliding Time-Scale doesn’t work because Peter would have graduated at 16 :/”  Graduating at 16???? Forget that,...
body:
“The Marvel Sliding Time-Scale doesn’t work because Peter would have graduated at 16 :/”

Graduating at 16???? Forget that, pal!!! That’s the least of his problems!!! His girlfriend was getting engaged when he was 16!!! He was planning on proposing when he was 16!!!! Aunt May expected him to be engaged for any relationship of his to be valid enough that he wouldn’t try to set him up with the neighbour’s niece at 15!!!! The Death of Gwen Stacy happened in 1973!!! That’s 10 years after his first appearance!!!! Going by the Sliding Time-Scale, 2 years had passed!!! He was 17 and talking about marriage with his girlfriend!!!! He was barely legal when he was having sex on rooftops with Felicia Hardy!!!

tags: spider man into the spider verse
summary: MILES MORALES! Yeah, so I hear there’s some kind of Spider-Man movie out this week? 😆 Used to do covers for Miles’ team book,...
body:
MILES MORALES! Yeah, so I hear there’s some kind of Spider-Man movie out this week? 😆 Used to do covers for Miles’ team book, called ALL-NEW ULTIMATES. It featured Spider-Woman, Cloak & Dagger, and Kitty Pryde too.

Did the first cover in a super stripped-down style and continued to be pretty experimental after that.

reblog.comment:

Did the first cover in a super stripped-down style and continued to be pretty experimental after that.

tags: makes soooooo much more sense now!!
bc that was one of my main issues with the film now tbh
it seemed like they were all letting peter off to easily because ofc we know why he did what he did but they don’t
summary: rewatching homecoming and I’ve seen a lot of people criticising how peter seemingly experiences a lack of consequences for his...
body:
rewatching homecoming and I’ve seen a lot of people criticising how peter seemingly experiences a lack of consequences for his actions, particularly within school, but I think people are forgetting that peter lost ben only months ago - when you consider how new peter is to being spider-man, it can’t have been longer than a year since peter lost the person who was basically his dad.

when you consider that, the fact that the team and liz let him off so easily and seem so forgiving of his erratic behaviour and that the school seems to let him off so easily for everything makes a LOT more sense - it makes so much more sense for them all to be so forgiving of peter when they’ve all seen him coping with ben’s death and they probably assume that whatever’s been going on with him is related to that (and I mean, they’re not totally wrong)
